source.name: 1.4 Test Your Knowledge - Rasa Actions
source.instructions: **What happens when a user message triggers a flow that includes an action in Rasa?**

answers.answer: Rasa executes the action's run() method directly from the flow file
Rasa finds the action class in the actions/ folder, executes its run() method, and the action uses the dispatcher to respond
The flow automatically sends a predefined response without executing any Python code
Rasa converts the action into a template and looks for a matching response in domain.yml

source.learningObjectives: SWBAT describe the execution flow when Rasa calls an action
source.guidance: When a flow includes an action step, Rasa looks for the corresponding Python class in the actions/ folder. It then executes that action's run() method, where you can write custom logic in Python. The action can use the dispatcher.utter_message() method to send dynamic responses back to the user. This is different from template responses which are predefined in domain.yml. The action execution happens outside the flow file - the flow just specifies which action to call.
